description: This file implements the VideoClient class, which provides functionality to sign in a user to a video service, process HTTP PUT requests including token management and retries, and interacts with device information sources. It includes methods for signing in, handling HTTP requests, and logging.

classes.name: VideoClient
classes.description: A class that handles video service client operations including authentication and HTTP communication.

methods.name: VideoClient::SignIn
methods.description: Signs in a user to the video service, constructing the appropriate URL and request body, and processing the HTTP PUT request.

methods.name: VideoClient::ProcessPut
methods.description: Handles the HTTP PUT request with token management, including retrying if the token has expired.

methods.name: uint32_t ProcessPut(const string & url,const string & data,string & response,string & responseHeader)
uint32_t SignIn(const std::string & appId,const std::string & scope,bool isSignedIn)
VideoClient(const string & host,const string & clientId,DeviceInfoPtr deviceInfoPtr)

ctags.name: ProcessPut
ctags.pattern: /^        uint32_t VideoClient::ProcessPut(const string &url, const string &data, string &response/
ctags.signature: (const string & url,const string & data,string & response,string & responseHeader)

ctags.name: SignIn
ctags.pattern: /^        uint32_t VideoClient::SignIn(const std::string& appId, const std::string& scope, bool is/

ctags.name: VideoClient
ctags.pattern: /^        VideoClient::VideoClient(const string &host, const string &clientId, DeviceInfoPtr devic/
